Hey Sebastian!

Hab im Zuge deines Announcements auch deine Website gecheck=
t. Sehr cool ; ) 

Werd mal sehen, ob sich meine studis f=C3=BCr euer Unity=
NEAT Projekt begeistern lassen=E2=80=A6

Cheers,
Sebastian

=E2=80=94
Dr. S=
ebastian von Mammen
Universit=C3=A4t Augsburg
Institut f=C3=BCr Angewandte =
Informatik
Lehrstuhl f=C3=BCr Organic Computing
Eichleitnerstr. 30
86159 Au=
gsburg

mail: sebastian.von.mammen@...-augsburg.de
www: www.vonm=
ammen.org
fon: (+49) 821 598 4639
fax: (+49) 821 598 4627

> On 24 Apr 2016=
, at 15:13, Sebastian Risi sebastian.risi@... [neat] <neat@yahoogroup=
s.com> wrote:
> 
> Hi all,
> 
> We're happy to announce two new papers, whi=
ch will be published at
> GECCO that try to address the challenge of evolvi=
ng adaptive neural
> networks.
> 
> Evolving adaptive neural networks has r=
emained challenging, mainly
> because of two reasons: (1) The networks have=
 difficulties retaining
> information over longer periods of time, and (2) =
evolving the ability
> to adapt has proven to be a rather deceptive problem=
.
> 
> In our paper "Accelerating the Evolution of Cognitive Behaviors
> Th=
rough Human-Computer Collaboration" by Mathias L=C3=B6we and myself, we
> s=
how that we can leverage human insights during the search for
> cognitive b=
ehaviors because of our ability to more easily distinguish
> between adapti=
ve and non-adaptive solutions than novelty or fitness-
> based approaches. =
This paper shows that the recently introduced method
> novelty-assisted int=
eractive evolution (NA- IEC), which combines human
> intuition with novelty=
 search, allows the evolution of cognitive
> behaviors in a T-Maze domain f=
aster than fully-automated searches by
> themselves.
> 
> Link to the PDF: =
http://sebastianrisi.com/wp-content/uploads/loewe_gecco16.pdf <http://sebas=
tianrisi.com/wp-content/uploads/loewe_gecco16.pdf>
> 
> In our second paper=
 "Evolving Neural Turing Machines for Reward-based
> Learning" by Rasmus Bo=
ll Greve, Emil Juul Jacobsen, and myself, we
> extend our recent work on ev=
olving Neural Turing Machines to give ANNs
> a more persistent type of memo=
ry. We show that the Evolvable Neural
> Turing Machine (ENTM) is able to so=
lve a simple copy tasks and for the
> first time, the continuous version of=
 the double T-Maze, a complex
> reinforcement-like learning problem. In the=
T-Maze learning task the
> agent uses the memory bank to display adaptive b=
ehavior that normally
> requires a plastic ANN, thereby suggesting a comple=
mentary and
> effective mechanism for adaptive behavior in NE.
> 
> Link to=
 the PDF: http://sebastianrisi.com/wp-content/uploads/greve_gecco16.pdf <ht=
tp://sebastianrisi.com/wp-content/uploads/greve_gecco16.pdf>
> 
> Video of =
an agent exploring the double T-Maze and ENTM source code:
> http://sebasti=
anrisi.com/entm <http://sebastianrisi.com/entm>
> 
> Looking forward to you=
r comments!
> 
> Best,
> Sebastian
> 
> -- 
> Dr. Sebastian Risi
> Associat=
e Professor
> IT University of Copenhagen, Room 5D12
> Rued Langgaards Vej =
7, 2300 Copenhagen, Denmark
> email: sebastian.risi@... <mailto:sebas=
tian.risi@...>, web: www.sebastianrisi.com <http://www.sebastianrisi.=
com/>
> mobile: +45-50250355, office: +45-7218-5018
> 
> 


--Apple-Mail=_880C5AFC-B33E-4552-A223-C18C7219C29F
